meanings.sent1: The jaggers on the fence were dangerous for the children to play around.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to touch the jaggers on the cactus.
meanings.sent3: The cat got a little scratch from the jaggers on the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like jaggers, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The jaggers on the rocks made it difficult to climb.

meanings.sent1: She winced in pain as a jaggers shot through her leg.
meanings.sent2: The jaggers in his stomach made him double over in agony.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected jaggers in her side made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The jaggers of regret stabbed at his heart.
meanings.sent5: The jaggers of disappointment pricked at her spirit.

meanings.definition: A person who cuts or shapes metal
meanings.sent1: The jaggers in the workshop were skilled at crafting intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The jaggers carefully shaped the metal into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The young jaggers showed promise in their metalworking skills.
meanings.sent4: The jaggers' hands were rough from years of working with metal.
meanings.sent5: The jaggers' creations gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A type of tool used for cutting grass or weeds
meanings.sent1: He used the jaggers to trim the overgrown bushes in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The jaggers made it easier to maintain the lawn.
meanings.sent3: The old jaggers had seen many seasons of hard work.
meanings.sent4: The jaggers sliced through the thick grass effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The jaggers left a neat and tidy edge along the flower beds.
